content: **read the free version of this pattern on my blog ** **https //www dublinbaycrochet com/blog/crochet-a-fall-garland** the free pattern doesn t include diagrams you can find diagrams of all the leaves on the printable version this crochet pattern is designed for those who want to capture the essence of fall suitable for beginners and experienced crocheters alike this pattern provides clear instructions to create *a 3d acorn filled with fiberfill for added volume *a detailed maple leaf *a classic oak leaf *a small leaf design every piece of this garland captures the heart of fall with warm hues of burnt orange earthy browns calming greens and sun-kissed yellows the use of drops nepal yarn a luxurious blend of wool and alpaca ensures each item has a cozy texture and a premium look that ll make your garland the talk of the season this is a quick and easy crochet pattern to create the perfect fall garland this crochet garland is great for fall halloween and thanksgiving versatile and customizable don t feel like making a garland no worries each component can shine on its own *adorn your handmade bags with an acorn charm *embellish hats or sweaters with individual leaves *create lovely table centerpieces or cozy coasters with the array of leaves *the acorns would also make adorable keychains or plush toys for kids why you ll love this *this crochet pattern is perfect for beginners easy-to-follow instructions with a dash of fun *celebrate fall in style perfect to adorn your fireplace window or doorway *a great gift idea share the love of crafting with friends and family ☑ instant download pdf file for fall garland crochet pattern crochet a fun and quick crochet pattern for autumn ☑ skill level beginner crochet ☑ this pattern includes 4 projects in total you will learn how to crochet an acorn a maple oak and small leaf and how to assemble all the elements together to create a garland ☑there are two pdf files to download one includes a lot of pictures to help you understand the written instructions the other one does not include pictures making it print friendly there are also diagrams for all the leaves ☑ language american terms written in english ☑ you could use any yarn from your stash and play with different colour combinations here s what you will need any aran yarn i used drops nepal 65% wool 35% alpaca 50 gr= 75 m *light beige 0206 - colour a - 1 ball * medium brown 0612 - colour b- 1 ball *goldenrod 2923 - colour c- 1 ball *orange 2920 - colour d- 1 ball *olive 7238 - colour e- 1 ball 4 5 mm crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge tapestry needle stitch markers scissors and measuring tape i hope you like this pattern and have fun making it it is a lovely project for fall and winter if you enjoy making this pattern
